title: Analyzing Dramatic Twists in The Traitors Season Four
summary: This BBC Entertainment article reviews key moments from the fourth series of The Traitors UK, a reality TV show where traitors deceive faithfuls in a competitive game. A major twist this season was the introduction of a secret traitor wearing a red cloak, unknown to both viewers and other traitors initially, intended to immerse audiences in the faithfuls' perspective. The secret traitor was revealed as Fiona after four episodes, replacing banished traitor Hugo. Fiona's uncloaking sparked significant chaos; she admitted being 'drunk on power' and quickly clashed with fellow traitor Rachel over tactics involving Amanda, a former detective. Their conflict led to an awkward turret summit and Fiona's banishment, as her high-risk strategy backfired when the cast sided with Rachel. The article evaluates these explosive scenes, including dramatic reactions and strategic failures, providing a retrospective on the season's most memorable events post-finale.
